residuals_analysis.interpretation: Residuals are mostly centered around zero and show an approximately normal distribution, indicating no significant systematic bias in the model's errors.

feature_importances.interpretation: Alcohol content is the most significant predictor of wine quality, followed by sulphates and volatile acidity, providing key targets for actionable recommendations.

predicted_vs_actual_plot.title: Predicted vs. Actual Wine Quality Scores
predicted_vs_actual_plot.description: A scatter plot comparing the model's predictions against the true quality scores. Points clustering along the red 'ideal prediction' line indicate accurate predictions. The plot reveals a good general trend, although with some spread due to the discrete nature of quality scores and a tendency to predict closer to the mean for extreme values.

residuals_plot.title: Residuals Plot (Predicted vs. Actual - Predicted) & Distribution
residuals_plot.description: This plot combines a scatter plot of residuals against predicted values (showing errors relative to predictions) and a histogram of residual distribution. It demonstrates that errors are generally centered around zero and are mostly randomly distributed, with some banding caused by the discrete nature of the target variable. The histogram confirms an approximately normal distribution of errors.

accuracy_within_tolerance_plot.title: Model Accuracy Within ±1 Quality Point Tolerance
accuracy_within_tolerance_plot.description: A bar chart presenting the percentage of predictions that fall within ±1 quality point of the actual score. This 'accuracy-style' metric provides a practical measure of the model's reliability, indicating how often its predictions are 'close enough' for operational use.

model_development_process.data_loading_and_inspection: Dataset loaded and inspected for structure, data types, and missing values. Initial parsing error addressed by specifying semicolon separator.
model_development_process.data_preparation: Features (X) and target (y) separated, then split into 80% training and 20% testing sets using `random_state=42` for reproducibility. No feature scaling was applied as Random Forest is robust to scale differences.
model_development_process.model_training: A RandomForestRegressor was instantiated and trained with default parameters, aligning with the MVP mindset to establish a stable baseline.
model_development_process.model_evaluation: Performance assessed using Mean Absolute Error (MAE) and R-squared (R²) on the test set, complemented by 'accuracy within ±1 quality point' for practical interpretability.
model_development_process.feature_importance_extraction: Feature importances were extracted from the trained model to highlight the most influential chemical properties.
